icp.what_they_sell: Automotive software development services, including autonomous driving & ADAS, body electronics, chassis, cockpit, propulsion, Vehicle.OS, E/E architecture, network & middleware, embedded & smart engineering, virtual engineering, integrated diagnostics & aftersales transformation, cloud, edge analytics & data management, and vehicle engineering & design.
icp.customer_industry: Automotive OEMs (car manufacturers), Electric vehicle startups, Commercial vehicle manufacturers, Automotive Tier-1 suppliers needing software expertise, Automotive companies transitioning to Software-Defined Vehicles (SDV)
ideal_customer_characteristics: Transitioning from ICE to EV platforms
Does NOT have large in-house software team
Requires expertise in specific automotive software domains (e.g., ADAS, Vehicle.OS)
Looking for a strategic technology partner for long-term software development needs

serviceable_geography.notes: KPIT has a global reach with software centers of excellence worldwide.

avoid_company_types: Automotive software companies (COMPETITORS: Bosch, Continental, Aptiv, ZF)
Tier-1 suppliers with own software divisions
IT services companies focused on general IT, not automotive-specific software
Automotive consulting firms focused on strategy, not software development

prospects.name: General Motors
prospects.why_good_fit: As a large OEM, GM likely outsources some software development, especially in areas like autonomous driving, Vehicle.OS, and new EV platforms, to augment their internal teams.
prospects.what_they_do: General Motors designs, manufactures, and markets vehicles across various brands.

prospects.name: SparkCharge
prospects.why_good_fit: SparkCharge, as an EV charging solutions provider, likely needs automotive software development services to enhance their charging infrastructure, optimize energy management, and develop advanced features for their platform, especially in areas like Vehicle.OS integration or cloud data management.
prospects.what_they_do: SparkCharge provides mobile and stationary EV charging solutions and services for fleets, offering Charging-as-a-Service (CaaS) and related infrastructure.

prospects.name: Rivian
prospects.why_good_fit: As an EV manufacturer, Rivian likely needs automotive software development services, especially for areas like autonomous driving, Vehicle.OS, and cloud/edge analytics, and may outsource some of this work to accelerate development and innovation.
prospects.what_they_do: Rivian is an electric vehicle manufacturer that designs, develops, and produces electric trucks and SUVs.

prospects.name: QuantumScape
prospects.why_good_fit: As a battery manufacturer for EVs, QuantumScape likely needs automotive software development services for battery management systems, vehicle integration, and related applications, especially as they scale up production and integrate with automotive OEMs.
prospects.what_they_do: QuantumScape develops solid-state lithium-metal battery technology for electric vehicles.

prospects.name: NanoGraf Corporation
prospects.why_good_fit: NanoGraf, as a battery technology company focused on improving EV battery performance, likely needs automotive software development services for battery management systems, vehicle integration, and data analytics related to battery performance, fitting the seller's expertise.
prospects.what_they_do: NanoGraf develops and manufactures silicon-based anode materials for lithium-ion batteries, aiming to improve battery performance for electric vehicles and other applications.

prospects.name: Tesla
prospects.why_good_fit: Tesla, as an automotive OEM, could potentially outsource specific software development tasks related to autonomous driving, Vehicle.OS, or other areas where they need specialized expertise or to augment their internal teams.
prospects.what_they_do: Tesla designs, develops, manufactures, and sells electric vehicles, energy generation and storage systems, and related services.

prospects.name: Daimler Truck AG

prospects.name: Amplify Cell Technologies

prospects.what_they_do: Amplify Cell Technologies manufactures battery cells for heavy and medium-duty electric vehicles.

prospects.name: Volkswagen Group
prospects.why_good_fit: As a large automotive OEM, Volkswagen likely outsources some software development, especially in areas like autonomous driving, Vehicle.OS, and other advanced technologies, making them a potential buyer.
prospects.what_they_do: Volkswagen Group is a multinational automotive manufacturer that designs, manufactures, and sells a wide range of vehicles.

prospects.name: International

prospects.what_they_do: Commercial Vehicle Group (CVG) is a leading supplier of electric vehicle assemblies, electrical wire harnesses, seating systems, mechanical assemblies, and plastic products primarily to the commercial vehicle, electric vehicle, e-commerce, and other markets.

prospects.why_good_fit: As a manufacturer of various vehicle types, REV Group could potentially require automotive software development services for their vehicles, especially as they integrate more advanced technologies.
